H0.text: Evolution is confirmed by the similarities and differences between genomes, which reveal patterns of evolution.

H1.text: Phylum is the pattern confirmed by the similarities and differences between the genomes.

H2.text: Fossils are the patterns that the similarities and differences between genomes confirm.

H3.text: Variation is confirmed by the similarities and differences between the genomes, which confirm patterns of variation.

A4.text: The development of molecular genetics has revealed the record of evolution left in organisms' genomes: dating when species diverged through the molecular clock produced by mutations.

A5.text: For example, these DNA sequence comparisons have revealed that humans and chimpanzees share 98% of their genomes and analysing the few areas where they differ helps shed light on when the common ancestor of these species existed.
